snippet: A 2010 ruling that set the stage for unlimited donations to “super PACs” also enabled unions to send their foot soldiers to the homes of voters who don’t belong to unions.
abstract: AFL-CIO is planning a major door-to-door effort as part of their endorsement of Pres Obama, sending out at least 400,000 members in an attempt to counter the well-endowed super PACs backing Republicans; Supreme Court ruling that set the stage for expanded super PACs also allows unions to send members to non-union homes, move expected to significantly increase labor's political clout in the upcoming elections.
lead_paragraph: A 2010 ruling that set the stage for unlimited donations to “super PACs” also enabled unions to send their foot soldiers to the homes of voters who don’t belong to unions.

headline.seo: Union Leaders Plan a Door-to-Door Effort to Aid Obama
headline.main: Labor Leaders Plan to Apply New Clout in Effort for Obama
headline.print_headline: Labor Leaders Plan Door-to-Door Effort for Obama
